text: Head to the Seat of Divine Foresight to ask about the situation

title: Mission Description
content: After the end of the grand battle against Phantylia, Fu Xuan called for starskiffs and sent everyone back to Exalting Sanctum.However, all of you still struggle to see the full picture behind the rise of the Ambrosial Arbor and the details concerning your time spent on the Xianzhou. Therefore, you all head to the Seat of Divine Foresight to ask for answers.

text: Some time later, you arrive at the Seat of Divine Foresight to check on Jing Yuan...

speaker: Qingzu
line: Can you wait a little moment? The master diviner will be here soon.

speaker: Qingzu
line: She's temporarily taken on the general's responsibilities. Before meeting you, she must make the current situation known and fortify public spirit. This is her first real test as a general — I hope she can get used to things quickly.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ...I don't think I can ever get used to this.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: *sigh* It's a pleasure to see you all here today.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Collating casualties and losses, dispatching forces to round up the remnants of the Disciples , submitting battle reports to the Six Charioteers ... Now I know what Jing Yuan meant when he said "the highest throne faces the strongest winds."

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Generalship is no trifling matter — how could I be "enjoying myself?" All I can do is get used to it, hmph...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: (I think she's enjoying herself...)

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Generalship is no trifling matter — it is a duty one must bear.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: (I think she actually really enjoys it...)

speaker: Welt
line: Master Diviner, have you summoned us here just to sigh and complain?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Of course not! On the contrary, I am eager to thank you all in my official capacity as acting general of the Luofu. Now that things have drawn to a conclusion, it is time to reward you.

speaker: March 7th
line: Oooo! All those benefits that the general promised — they're finally here! Yippee!

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Yes, the Astral Express has braved great evil for the Luofu. Your devotion is evident. After discussions with the Six Charioteers, you are henceforth sworn allies of the Luofu. Within the Luofu's jurisdiction, you are to be treated with the highest standard of diplomatic protocol.

speaker: Welt
line: On behalf of the Astral Express, I would like to thank you, Master Diviner.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wow, nothing tangible then, but at least it sounds pretty cool...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Now that thanks have been expressed, I still have something to discuss with you. Please, this way.

text: Go through the events surrounding the Ambrosial Arbor's calamity with Fu Xuan

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Seriously? Thanking us like that, and then immediately sending us on another mission?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: It's not a mission. The Stellaron crisis, the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus rebellion, the Arbor's resurrection, not to mention the Antimatter Legion infiltrating the Luofu... All of these incidents need reporting at the highest level for investigation.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ...It's just that, having been in the middle of everything, I'm struggling to keep an accurate perspective. I would appreciate if you could go through it all with me, so that I can reacquaint myself with the finer detail.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: So, where should we begin?

children.text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Obsequies Performed, A Long Road Ahead 1 Stelle.mp4 Media:Trailblaze Mission Obsequies Performed, A Long Road Ahead 1 Caelus.mp4

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: It appears that Phantylia was the mastermind behind it all. The Xianzhou warred with the Antimatter Legion in the past, and ever since we have kept a watchful eye on their movements.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Few could have foreseen the insidious tactics employed in the execution of their assaults. The Lord Ravager slithered in unnoticed, clandestinely plotting and machinating, and surreptitiously bestowed a Stellaron upon the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. This heinous act instigated an uprising aimed at luring the Luofu into a perilous trap of self-destruction.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: The present danger posed by the Legion clearly demands a re-evaluation. We should proceed cautiously.

text: Let's talk about the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus...

children.text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Obsequies Performed, A Long Road Ahead 2.mp4

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: When the Ambrosial Arbor was severed by the Reignbow Arbiter thousands of years ago, the Abundance became a taboo. Those within the Alchemy Commission — the original masters of the so-called "way of immortality" — were ruined at a stroke. The commission became a shadow of its former self.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Presumably, from that moment on, the seeds of discord for the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus had already been planted... Some of them were willing to work with the enemy, acquiring a Stellaron from the Antimatter Legion to try and revive the Abundance .

children.text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Obsequies Performed, A Long Road Ahead 3.mp4

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Hmm... They succeeded alright, but why would Phantylia's objective be to realize their wishes? Those traitors gained nothing — they betrayed the Xianzhou only to become sacrificial offerings in the Lord Ravager's grand scheme.

children.text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Obsequies Performed, A Long Road Ahead 4 Stelle.mp4 Media:Trailblaze Mission Obsequies Performed, A Long Road Ahead 4 Caelus.mp4

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: The Stellaron Hunters? We know just as little. But in the Matrix of Prescience, I saw a prophecy that Kafka received from Destiny's Slave . Elio foresaw all manner of possibilities for the Luofu...

children.text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Obsequies Performed, A Long Road Ahead 5.mp4

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Based on what Kafka knows, and despite everything being under the control of Elio, that prophecy is indeed the most beneficial future for the Luofu. The Stellaron Hunters walked right into our trap, and even gifted allies — in the form of yourselves — to the Xianzhou... That might sound self-interested, but I hope the feeling is mutual.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Now that future has come true, the Xianzhou has discovered the Legion's intentions, and with everyone's help, has imposed a crushing defeat on Phantylia.

text: I think we already have the gist...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: That we may, but as logical as things might seem, there are still many details about which we're uncertain.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: For example, how was the Stellaron brought onto the Xianzhou? And who sent it on to Scalegorge Waterscape ? How many Disciples of Sanctus Medicus still remain at large? All of this is a mystery. Thus far, we've done our best.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: I'm submitting my written report to the Alliance, and I've already got a plan in mind. All of you will feature in the report, but for the sake of Jing Yuan, anything related to Xianzhou internal affairs will have names redacted — I hope you can forgive me.

speaker: Welt
line: I was about to make the same request, Master Diviner. Since the Arbor's resurrection, I'm sure the Alliance will be poring over every detail of the report. I fear that if the Astral Express gets dragged into matters, leaving will not be an easy task.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Mm. Jing Yuan has committed quite a few violations this time around, and I'll have to deal with them one by one... *sigh* The Cloud Knight generals are all such a hassle.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Before you leave, please make time to recuperate. If there's anywhere you'd like to visit, feel free to take a look. I must attend to some Cloud Knight matters — farewell for now.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Oh — if you pass through Starskiff Haven, I have something that I hope you can give to Yukong.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: *sigh* It was all so chaotic. When Phantylia took form, it was as if Tingyun vanished into thin air.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: The Cloud Knights were only able to find her fan — she took it with her everywhere. It's currently unclear if Tingyun was a puppet manipulated by Phantylia, or if some form of deception was used to cloud our vision.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: I'm already prepared for the worst. Considering how the Legion operates, I fear the fate of the Sky-Faring Commission Amicassador may be a bleak one.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: As for how matters are handled with regards to Tingyun, I believe it's best left to her foxian kin. I have informed the Sky-Faring Commission of the events which took place, and I think it would be best if you were the one to deliver this item to Yukong.

speaker: Welt
line: ...I understand. Leave it with us.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Thank you, Mr. Yang. Now, let me take a look at my remaining duties for the day. *sigh* It's quite the list...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: It's getting late. If you need me, I'll be in the Divination Commission Conclave Hall .

text: Head to the Palace of Astrum and give Yukong with the item that has been entrusted to you

title: Step Description
content: Fu Xuan had entrusted you to head to the Sky-Faring Commission and give to Yukong the fan "Tingyun" left behind. Whether Phantylia was disguised as Tingyun or mind-controlled her — both spell out dangerous possibilities. The real Tingyun might have suffered a lethal accident.

speaker: March 7th
line: Well, we had a lot of stumbles along the way, but we still managed to kick butt and save the Luofu without breaking a sweat. Feels kinda surreal.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ▶ (Trailblazer), you don't sound very happy.

text: We're just mere puppets of the Stellaron Hunters...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Bah, no way! Everything good has come our way due to our hard work. I'm not letting them take any of the credit.

speaker: March 7th
line: It may seem like the Stellaron Hunters are controlling everything, but we create our own future. No matter how powerful they are, they can't make a future that doesn't exist come true.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Since showing up, we've saved a lot of people and averted disaster for the whole Xianzhou. Who cares whether someone or something was directing it? Be happy, (Trailblazer)!

text: What are your plans from here?

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Actually, I was wondering if Diviner Fu could do me a favor.

speaker: March 7th
line: The Matrix of Prescience has amazing powers, and can iterate and reiterate Kafka's past... So it got me thinking — if I turned the Matrix on me, could it calculate my past?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hee-hee, yup! When you're free, let's head over to the Divination Commission together and ask them for a favor.

text: Why didn't you ask Fu Xuan for help while she was here?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I was shy! Talking about personal stuff like that in front of everyone... it'd be too embarrassing!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: When you're free, let's go hit up the Divination Commission together and see what Fu Xuan has to say.

speaker: March 7th
line: Here's hoping the Matrix is accurate, and that Diviner Fu won't decline our request...

speaker: Welt
line: Things have come to a close for now. It's good that you came through unscathed.

text: Thanks for looking out for me, Mr. Yang.
What are we going to do next?

speaker: Welt
line: The master diviner asked us to pass on this item of Tingyun's. I'll go to the Palace of Astrum and meet with Yukong. If neither of you has anything urgent, it'd be best if you came too.

speaker: Welt
line: How am I gonna break this to Madam Yukong...? Maybe she's already heard the news.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Returning to the Luofu and Scalegorge Waterscape... it's a surreal feeling.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I left so determined... Who would have thought that circumstances would draw me back once more?

text: It's not like the Xianzhou has done anything to you... yet.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: There are only a handful of individuals who know my identity now. I do not wish to guess what could occur if word gets out.

text: How long do you plan on staying here?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I'll be gone very soon. Jing Yuan is still recovering, and the Cloud Knights won't protect me anymore... It remains to be seen how the Six Charioteers will react to my presence.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But at least for now, I'm safe.

text: What are you going to do next?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I want to meet the current high elder of the Vidyadhara .

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It seems I won't be able to cast off Dan Feng 's negative karma... so I'd like to learn more about his past. I want to find out what I can do to make up for his sins.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ If you're planning on an extended stay on the Luofu, I'm afraid I won't be able to join you. I'm sorry, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I want to meet the current high elder of the Vidyadhara.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: If she can tell me more about Dan Feng's actions, then perhaps I can do something to make up for his sins.

speaker: Qingzu
line: The Ambrosial Arbor is dormant. Thanks to everyone's hard-fought battles, the Luofu is safe once more.

speaker: Qingzu
line: Before he left, the general told me to handle things at the Seat of Divine Foresight. Fortunately, now that victory has been achieved, the plans we prepared will never see the light of day. However...

speaker: Qingzu
line: The general did order that if he were unable to return to duty, then the master diviner would take over his duties temporarily.

children.speaker: Qingzu
children.line: Alas, I'm no healer, I'm afraid I couldn't say.

children.speaker: Qingzu
children.line: I ordered a military doctor to provide the most comprehensive emergency treatment they could. The Alchemy Commission was caught up in the Sanctus Medicus conspiracy — it took a lot of work to find someone trustworthy enough to heal the general.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: If we can help, don't hesitate to ask. I don't know much about medicine, but... there are lots of ways to seal wounds and prevent injuries from worsening.

children.speaker: Qingzu
children.line: Don't worry, long-life species are resilient and strong — the general will pull through. He's faced down situations a hundred times more dangerous than this.

text: What do you plan on doing with the Ambrosial Arbor?

children.speaker: Qingzu
children.line: What do we plan on doing... *sigh* Thousands of years ago, the Xianzhou Alliance was at its wit's end trying to deal with it. Today, nothing's changed.

children.speaker: Qingzu
children.line: The Arbor was resurrected. Aside from the Arbiter's Lux Arrow, I'm afraid that nothing can materially harm it. We might be able to suppress it with the help of the Vidyadhara, but with internal strife ravaging their ranks, I'm afraid it's a long shot...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: If you can locate exactly where the Stellaron is within the Arbor, then the Express might be able to help out.

children.speaker: Qingzu
children.line: Thank you for your kind offer, Mr. Yang. But something as important and fundamental as the Ambrosial Arbor will require a meeting and deliberation from the Six Charioteers.

text: Fu Xuan seems to be handling things pretty well...

speaker: Qingzu
line: Better to wait until the master diviner has another twenty or thirty years under her belt.

speaker: Qingzu
line: Subduing the enemy is one of the most minor parts of a general's work. They have to meet with the Luofu's Six Charioteers and undergo Ten-Lords Commission inspections — all while dealing with the Xianzhou Alliance's top brass...

speaker: Qingzu
line: None of it is easy to navigate, but it's a daily responsibility. The crown of a general sits heavy on the head indeed.

speaker: Qingzu
line: I almost forgot — I need to gather data for the master diviner's draft report. Bye for now.

speaker: Qingzu
line: The Luofu's troubles... have only just begun. I don't know if the master diviner can take all this on.

speaker: Yukong
line: I see. Please extend my regards to the Ten Lords...

speaker: Xueyi
line: I will. Our condolences, Helm Master.

speaker: Xueyi
line: You have guests. I shall take my leave.

speaker: Yukong
line: Ahem... On behalf of the Sky-Faring Commission, I would like to thank the crew of the Express for saving the Luofu from the Stellaron crisis.

speaker: Welt
line: Madam Yukong must have heard about Miss Tingyun...

speaker: Yukong
line: Yes, I have heard. Seeing four leave, yet only three return, was enough for me to know that Fu Xuan's report was indeed correct.

speaker: Yukong
line: Tingyun...

speaker: Yukong
line: I still can't believe it. The whole report reads like a bad joke — it's simply unimaginable.

speaker: Yukong
line: The Antimatter Legion on the Xianzhou? And Tingyun... a Lord Ravager?

speaker: Yukong
line: How could someone who spent over thirty years working alongside me at the Sky-Faring Commission... turn out to be nothing more than a monster in disguise? What happened to the real Tingyun?

speaker: March 7th
line: Madam Yukong...

speaker: Yukong
line: I'm sorry... I understand... It's just hard for me to accept...

speaker: Yukong
line: *sigh* Thank you for bringing Tingyun's belongings back to the Palace of Astrum. The Stellaron crisis has cost us too many comrades, brothers, sisters... children.

speaker: Yukong
line: I'd like to invite all of you, as witnesses to this war, to a soul-soothing ceremony hosted by the Sky-Faring Commission. Will you consider?

speaker: Welt
line: A "soul-soothing ceremony"?

speaker: Yukong
line: To put it into short-life terms — a funeral. You see, for long-life species of the Xianzhou, death has always been a distant, mystical concept.

speaker: Yukong
line: Ordinarily, the Ten-Lords Commission guides people to the Hall of Karma before any symptoms of mara are detected. There, they leave behind their lives and wait for their time to come. People are used to a short "farewell" as opposed to a tedious "burial" process.

speaker: Yukong
line: Given our limited life spans, the only ones who place value on ceremony are us foxians.

speaker: Yukong
line: Countless Cloud Knights lost their lives or became mara-struck during the crisis. The Hall of Karma couldn't take them all in, and so they passed away.

speaker: Yukong
line: All of these sudden deaths and unfulfilled wishes remind us... that long-life species still live out insignificant and limited lives.

speaker: Yukong
line: By combining Sky-Faring Commission technology with foxian ceremony, we honor those who have passed on. We place items of the dead onto starskiffs, and send them out to sail between the stars — to shine brightly among them.

speaker: Yukong
line: It's not just to comfort the dead — those souls who can never talk with us again — but also to comfort their surviving relatives, close friends, and indeed all residents of the Xianzhou...

speaker: Yukong
line: It's also my way of saying farewell to Tingyun. I know, I'm selfish. She may not have died a Cloud Knight, but she's still one of us here at the Sky-Faring Commission — a victim caught up in a wider conflict.

speaker: Yukong
line: I'd like to hold this ceremony as a way of distancing the memory of Tingyun from the Lord Ravager who tarnished her identity.

speaker: Yukong
line: I... can still hardly believe it. I'll use my own methods to locate Tingyun's whereabouts, but at present... I...

speaker: Yukong
line: This is the least I can do for her.

speaker: Yukong
line: I'd like to ask you all to witness this event with me.

text: We'll be there at the ceremony.

speaker: Yukong
line: I've instructed Yanming to sort through Tingyun's belongings. I hope you can pick some out to place around the starskiff.

speaker: Welt
line: Leave this to us, we'll take care of it as per your wishes, Madam Yukong.

speaker: Yukong
line: Once again, my thanks to all of you. I've asked the judges of the Ten-Lords Commission to ratify this soul-soothing ceremony, and have commissioned a special skiff at Stargazer Navalia for the ceremony. If you need anything, that's where I'll be.

text: Sort through Tingyun's things with Yanming

title: Step Description
content: Fu Xuan had entrusted you to head to the Sky-Faring Commission and give to Yukong the fan "Tingyun" left behind. Whether Phantylia was disguised as Tingyun or mind-controlled her — both spell out dangerous possibilities. The real Tingyun might have suffered a lethal accident.Barely holding herself up in her immense sorrow, Helm Master Yukong insists on holding a "soul-soothing ceremony" to appease the pain everyone must be feeling. You and Yanming work through the items Tingyun left behind in the Palace of Astrum, only to discover that some were in fact gifts yet to be sent out...

speaker: Yanming
line: You always did say that I liked to gossip, and here I am rambling on proving you right again... If only you were here to cut me off...

text: ...Or you could just cut yourself off?

speaker: Yanming
line: Oh! It's you... For a moment I thought she'd returned... Did the Helm Master send you over?

speaker: March 7th
line: We're here to help sort out Miss Tingyun's things. Madam Yukong wants to use some of them for her soul-soothing ceremony.

speaker: Yanming
line: Well, I've managed to get through pretty much everything — it's all in this box. Please, take your time.

speaker: March 7th
line: Okay, let's see what there is.

speaker: March 7th
line: An Amicassador's seal, a small box... a knife? A bow, and something wrapped up tight... I wonder what this is.

speaker: March 7th
line: Looks like some kind of antique? But who'd want to hold on to something like this...

speaker: Yanming
line: Oh, Tingyun explained that one to me. It's a folk statuette from foxian antiquity. They say it can bring wealth if placed correctly.

speaker: March 7th
line: There's also a note in the package: "This is for you, Mr. Yanming. Wishing you fortune and success in every endeavor." Yanming, it seems like this is a gift for you from Miss Tingyun.

speaker: Yanming
line: I... I remember asking her for one at the time... Ahem, this is unexpected. I only mentioned it in passing, but she remembered.

speaker: Yanming
line: ...Tingyun and I were from different guilds. We were competitors... but also colleagues.

speaker: Yanming
line: When we used to trade in other lands, we would bring back local specialties and distribute them among friends and other guild members — it became a custom.

speaker: Yanming
line: The rivalry between us and Whistling Flames to be the Sky-Faring Commission's top guild was always fierce. We would gift each other all kinds of bizarre oddities: Candy that made your leg hair grow, a violin that could shatter glass with its piercing shriek...

speaker: Yanming
line: *sigh* ...I was completely unprepared for this. I never thought Tingyun would leave something behind for me that was so sincere and earnest.

speaker: Yanming
line: If I don't return a gift, I'll lose our little duel... But what could I possibly gift her back?

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh, besides the seal, the knife, and the bow... None of this seems like something Miss Tingyun would've kept. I thought she was more about jewelry and beauty.

speaker: March 7th
line: Could there be other things similar to what Yanming got? We should take a look.

text: I want to take a look in that box...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: There's nothing else... except a handful of seeds.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: It looks like there's something printed on the bottom of the box... The Sleepless Earl. Let me think — where have I seen that name before?

text: I want to take a look at that knife...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I can't cook to save my life, but one thing I'm sure of is: That's a kitchen knife.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I've never seen Miss Tingyun use anything like that to defend herself... It must be another gift that she never had time to send.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: There's an ad in the knife case: "Spices Supreme," Aurum Alley? Which store is that again?

text: I want to take a look at that bow...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: This bow...

children.text: March plucks the bowstring.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: It's a good bow. It couldn't be meant for me... could it?

children.text: Think again...
I'm sure you weren't the only archer she knew.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Alright, just kidding. Just trying to liven things up around here.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Do you know where we're supposed to take these things, (Trailblazer)?

text: (ObtainThe Amicassador's Seal×1,Small Chest Sent to the Sleepless Earl×1,Kitchen Knife Sent to Spices Supreme×1,  andAn Archery Set Gifted For Someone Unknown×1)
Give the gift to Mengming from the Sleepless Earl

speaker: Yanming
line: Tingyun, Tingyun... What am I going to get for you? If only you... *sigh*

speaker: Welt
line: The Sleepless Earl... Was that the name of that teahouse at the port when we first got into town?

speaker: Mengming
line: Welcome to the Sleepless Earl! I'm the owner here — the name's Mengming. How many of you are there? Which tea would you like today?

text: We're here on a gift-giving errand for Miss Tingyun...

speaker: Mengming
line: Oh! This is... This is the tea Miss Tingyun promised to get for me! She really went to another world for this? She's incredible.

speaker: Mengming
line: When I took over this teahouse from my parents, I thought I'd shake things up by creating a new tea product.

speaker: Mengming
line: Famous brews like Whale-Tide Spring or Vegetations in the Alchemy Cauldron have been around for millennia, and imported mixed teas have also found a niche. Introducing a new product into the industry is really hard.

speaker: Mengming
line: Miss Tingyun came to the teahouse one day and heard about my troubles — she said she could find me a brand-new strain during her travels — one that nobody on the Xianzhou had ever tasted.

speaker: Mengming
line: I just thought she was trying to cheer me up — I never thought she'd actually do it... Where is Miss Tingyun today?

text: She's had to embark on another long voyage...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: ...Yes. Now that the crisis has been averted and the ports are resuming operations, Miss Tingyun has been dispatched on business with the Sky-Faring Commission... out to other worlds.

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: Oh, really? That's a shame. Well... hold on a sec.

children.text: A few moments later, Mengming serves the tea she brewed.

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: Based on her suggestion, I improved the Whale-Tide Spring, Emerald Hills, and Dawndew strains to make a new variety with a sweet, long-lasting taste. I called it "Tingyun's Blend."

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: Seeing as she can't enjoy it right now, I'll have to invite all of you to try a cup.

children.text: You tell Mengming about what happened to Tingyun...

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: Miss Tingyun...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: We found this box of seeds among her belongings. I'm sure Miss Tingyun would have liked for you to have it.

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: ...Thank you, all of you. I think... I should gift something to Tingyun in return.

children.text: A few moments later, Mengming serves the tea she brewed.

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: Based on her suggestion, I improved the Whale-Tide Spring, Emerald Hills, and Dawndew strains to make a new variety with a sweet, long-lasting taste. I called it "Tingyun's Blend."

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: Seeing as Tingyun won't be able to try it... we should drink a cup to her memory.

text:
(Talk to Mengming again, optional)
(If Mengming was told that Tingyun has left to other worlds)

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: I can't wait for Miss Tingyun to try this tea!

text: (If Mengming was told that Tingyun has died)

children.speaker: Mengming
children.line: I'm sorry you won't be able to try this tea, Miss Tingyun...

speaker: Qingque
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), how's it going? Did you take some time off? See any more of the Xianzhou?

text: Have you heard of Spices Supreme?

speaker: Qingque
line: Isn't that the place on Aurum Alley over in Exalting Sanctum? All the foodies go there. What about it? Planning on treating me to a feast?

text: (If Aurum Alley has not been visited before)

children.text: Aurum Alley?
Go on...

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: It's the main commercial street in the Exalting Sanctum, although it's a lot quieter since the whole Stellaron crisis thing.

speaker: Qingque
line: Tourists fresh off the starskiff always head to Starwatcher Avenue in Starskiff Haven — it's one of those bustling tourist streets... But, if you want the real deal on local snacks, you've gotta get to Aurum Alley. I've marked it out for you on your map.

speaker: Qingque
line: Whenever I'm tired of celestial jade or slacking off, I head over for a bowl of Granny Chen's Tofu. Darn it, now that you've brought it up, I suddenly don't feel like clocking in for work anymore.

text: Give the gift to Yancui from Spices Supreme

speaker: March 7th
line: Spices Supreme... Check out that sign. Here it is!

speaker: Yancui
line: Honored guests, welcome to our humble eatery! What can we get for you today?

text: We're here on a gift-giving errand for Miss Tingyun...

speaker: Yancui
line: Something from Miss Tingyun for me...?

speaker: Yancui
line: Hahaha, what a precious person she is. A sweet thing like her, gifting me a kitchen knife.

speaker: Yancui
line: When she first ate here, I told her my motto: "You can't better your own food unless you taste it." Then she got me to talk about my hunting and cooking experiences out on other worlds.

speaker: Yancui
line: She was captivated — she pestered me about dish after dish... At the end, she mentioned she wanted to get me a gift: "A sword for a hero, and a knife for a chef" — that's how she put it.

speaker: Yancui
line: She probably came across some rare mineral and forged it by hand. Look how sharp it is! I bet it'd cut straight through a Thalassa Titanium Terrapin shell.

speaker: Yancui
line: *sigh* Miss Tingyun is too kind. Who among the Aurum Alley vendors hasn't been spoiled by the generosity of Whistling Flames? Her Grand Fair puts small merchants like us in touch with big intergalactic vendors. If we're talking gifts, it's us who should be gifting her something.

speaker: Yancui
line: I heard the trade port is open again for business. Miss Tingyun must be real busy, right?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Miss Tingyun couldn't tear herself away from work, so we've had to gift this on her behalf today.

children.speaker: Yancui
children.line: Really, thank you so much. Why don't I give you all a demonstration and prepare a dish? My treat — I'd love to repay this kindness.

children.text: Yancui goes into the back kitchen and brings out a steaming bowl of food.

children.speaker: Yancui
children.line: Speaking of which, it was our Chili Beef Offal Stew that first attracted Miss Tingyun to our restaurant, hehe. It's spicy, sumptuous, and guaranteed to get the mouth watering. Not even a girl as refined as Tingyun could resist the temptation.

children.text: You tell Yancui what happened to Tingyun...

children.speaker: Yancui
children.line: This... This is real, right...?

children.speaker: Yancui
children.line: The monster you mentioned... where did it come from? ...I wish—I wish I could take this knife and cut it to ribbons...

children.speaker: Yancui
children.line: *sigh* Forget it... matters like these are beyond the control and understanding of a cook like me... Thank you, all of you. Let me prepare a dish for you... as a gift for Miss Tingyun.

children.text: Yancui goes into the back kitchen and brings out a steaming bowl of food.

children.speaker: Yancui
children.line: It was our Chili Oil Beef Offal Stew that first attracted Miss Tingyun to our restaurant... I can't believe that she'll never taste it again. Please, you'll have to eat her share too.

text:
(Talk to Yancui again, optional)
(If Yancui was told that Tingyun is busy)

children.speaker: Yancui
children.line: It's a shame Miss Tingyun's too busy today...

text: (If Yancui was told that Tingyun has died)

children.speaker: Yancui
children.line: If only Miss Tingyun could try this one last time...

text:
(After delivering the gifts to both Sleepless Earl and Spices Supreme)
(If bow hasn't been delivered yet)

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: About that bow — I think I know who Miss Tingyun intended to gift it to.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Mister Yanming said an Amicassador will return with a gift for a trusted colleague...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: The person who Tingyun trusts the most is Madam Yukong, right?

children.text: (Proceed to "Give the gift to Yukong in Stargazer Navalia" Step)

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: The things Miss Tingyun left behind have finally found their homes.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: It's time to go back to Stargazer Navalia and see Madam Yukong.

children.text: (Proceed to "Go to Stargazer Navalia and meet Yukong, who is overseeing the ceremony's preparations" Step)

text: Give the gift to Yukong in Stargazer Navalia

speaker: Yukong
line: What brings you here?

text: We're here to pass on a gift from Miss Tingyun...

speaker: Yukong
line: This bow... Did Tingyun pick it out for me? She understood my pain — it's a shame I can no longer do anything for her...

speaker: Yukong
line: Thirty years ago, I fought in a terrible war . My comrade and I set sail together, but only I returned.

speaker: Yukong
line: The scars of that war never truly healed. Still, the Luofu traced out its arc of recovery, and continued to trade...

speaker: Yukong
line: I felt tired of voyaging — like I'd lost the courage to pull on a bowstring ever again. I hid away in the Sky-Faring Commission and buried myself in work, never wanting to see the sky again.

speaker: Yukong
line: Despite rising to Helm Master, my military career hadn't prepared me for the type of meticulous planning work now confronting me. Tingyun, on the other hand, was a born merchant — always discussing business matters with me and offering up advice — even if she was my subordinate.

speaker: Yukong
line: She never fought alongside me on the battlefield, but in her own way, she became a comrade-in-arms. Without the help of Tingyun and the guild, the Luofu would not have been able to recover in the space of just thirty short years.

speaker: Yukong
line: I used to think that the Xianzhou had changed with the times. Geniuses like Tingyun were the future for the Sky-Faring Commission's next generation — they would bring prosperity to the Luofu. I was only ever suited to the flames of war.

speaker: Yukong
line: I was wrong. Only when the last minions of the Antimatter Legion are wiped out, will I become useless to the Xianzhou... The Xianzhou needs people like me — those willing to cruise the sky and fight the flames.

speaker: Yukong
line: Tingyun prepared gifts for others, too? That's just like her...

speaker: Yukong
line: Thank you for helping her complete all these tasks. She can depart in peace.

speaker: Yukong
line: We're still preparing the starskiff for the ceremony. Please, everyone, come back to me when your work is complete.

text: (If other gifts have been delivered, proceed to next step immediately)

speaker: Yukong
line: I heard Tingyun prepared gifts for others, too? That's just like her...

speaker: Yukong
line: Thank you for helping her complete all these tasks. She can depart in peace.

speaker: Yukong
line: We're still preparing the starskiff for the ceremony. Please, everyone, come back to me when your work is complete.

text: Go to Stargazer Navalia and meet Yukong, who is overseeing the ceremony's preparations

speaker: Yukong
line: The starskiff is ready for the ceremony now. Everyone, please place your objects aboard the starskiff.
W—Wait! Wait for me!

speaker: Yanming
line: Miss Tingyun prepared a gift for me. As a fellow Amicassador, I cannot fail to honor our custom...

speaker: March 7th
line: Yanming, what is it that you've prepared?

speaker: Yanming
line: I... I've brought a paper kite. I know it may seem simple compared to the precious items that Tingyun gifted others in the past... but it has a deeper meaning.

speaker: Yanming
line: I heard that foxians have a tradition where paper kites are used to comfort the souls of pilots who can no longer take to the skies. Tingyun and I were never pilots in the strictest sense of the word... but we spent much of our lives out among the stars.

speaker: Yanming
line: For her to be able to take wing once again... would make her very happy.

text: Select which of the gifts returned by the people you wish to place into the ceremony starskiff

title: Step Description
content: Deep in Stargazer Navalia, Yukong is overseeing the manufacture of the starskiff used for the soul-soothing ceremony. The two of you place the gifts of bygone days and let them depart with the starskiff, both for ordinary people who lost their lives during the Ambrosial Arbor's calamity and for the perished Cloud Knights.

speaker: Yukong
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), if you're ready, please select a few items to place aboard the starskiff.

speaker: Yanming
line: Paper kites are often gifted to children, but as a symbol of spreading one's wings and soaring high up into the sky, they are also a comfort to foxian pilots. It's an old tradition that's carried on to this day.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), out of all this stuff we've got, what do you think we should place on the starskiff?

children.speaker: Yukong
children.line: Thank you for everything you've done for the Sky-Faring Commission and the Luofu. This small seal is the foundation of the Xianzhou's prosperity.

children.text: (Return to option selection)

text: The tea named after her (If you drank the tea) ▶ ▶ March 7th: Hmm? (Trailblazer), did you forget that we already drank that back at the teahouse? (Return to option selection)

children.text: (If you did not drink the tea)

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: This is the tea that Mengming has made, especially named after you.

text: Her favorite dish (If you ate the dish) ▶ March 7th: Uh, you already ate that, remember? I can't just get you another one now, can I? (Return to option selection)

children.text: (If you did not eat dish)

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: This is a gift from Miss Yancui on behalf of all the restaurants on Aurum Alley. You are going to love this.

children.speaker: Yanming
children.line: This time, we needn't compete. Go, fly on to other distant worlds.

children.text: (Return to option selection)

text: (Once all the options have been chosen)

speaker: Yukong
line: The Sky-Faring Commission shall never forget you, Tingyun. I will seek out the truth, and if it is discovered that you were taken from us, I swear to avenge your unjust end.

speaker: Yukong
line: It is time for the soul-soothing ceremony. Please make your way to Earthrise Agora in Starskiff Haven.

text: Soon, the starskiff will carry the items you selected to the stars unknown, vanishing in the vastness of their halo.
Long-life or short-life, everyone sails towards the same destination.
Head to Starskiff Haven and participate in the soul-soothing ceremony

title: Step Description
content: The soul-soothing ceremony is about to begin in Starskiff Haven. Like how every star will eventually dim and be snuffed out, it is time to bid farewell to the dead for both short-life and long-life species.

speaker: Yanqing
line: General, the ceremony has finished. You should take a rest.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Not yet. I have things I wish to convey to my Astral friends.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: My apologies, I couldn't get to you any sooner — Yanqing made sure that I was fully recuperated...

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Before you leave the Luofu, there are two things I wish to gift the Express.

speaker: March 7th
line: Two gifts? Has his conscience finally gotten the better of him? Is he going to make up for all our hard work along the way?

text: I'd like some free real estate, please!

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Please, let us reconvene at the Seat of Divine Foresight.

text: Accept the token of alliance from Jing Yuan

title: Step Description
content: Jing Yuan invites you to have a chat at the Seat of Divine Foresight when the ceremony ends. Once there, he presents Luofu's gift to the Express Crew — a jade abacus of allying oath. With this token in hand, the Cloud Knights swear to come to the aid of their allies, no matter the distance they must cross. Your current trailblazing journey on the Xianzhou has finally come to an end.

speaker: Yukong
line: I once held the same ceremony on the Fanghu , some thirty years or so ago now. Painful memories don't ever fade away with time, and I don't want to bear witness to those scenes again.

speaker: Yukong
line: Once I've finished handling the various tasks at hand, I want to aid the Cloud Knights in their investigation. I'll fly out on a starskiff and trace Tingyun's original flight path onto the Xianzhou. Rest assured, I will leave no stone unturned.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Present company is gathered to reiterate the Xianzhou Luofu's esteemed gratitude for the magnanimous actions of the Nameless.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: I am sure Lady Fu has given voice to this already, but the Luofu is greatly indebted to you. Therefore, on behalf of the Luofu Cloud Knights, I hereby present you with a jade abacus — a symbol of our allied friendship.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: It... could indeed be considered a souvenir of a certain variety. But not one you could find in a gift store.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Back when the Alliance was first established — all those thousands of years ago — the Xianzhou ships swore an oath, etching the record into a jade abacus. The world may crumble and the heavens may fall, but this oath shall never be broken.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: The same is true of this jade abacus — it is a record of the Luofu Cloud Knights' promise to the crew of the Astral Express. It is also a beacon — grip it tightly, and it will send a message to the jade abacus here in my hand.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: No matter how astronomically distant you are, the Luofu Cloud Knights will always come to the aid of the Crew, whatever your need may be.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wow, now that's what I call a pay-off.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Ahem... Of course, I trust that such an important article will not be used for trivial or inappropriate circumstances. I hope you can understand...

speaker: March 7th
line: Yup, got it. Say no more. Sure thing.

speaker: Welt
line: Thank you for your generosity, General.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Dan Heng.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: General...

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: In accordance with the edict of the Ten-Lords Commission, I am hereby authorized to relieve your banishment decree. From this day henceforth, you may come and go freely on the Luofu...

speaker: March 7th
line: Nice!

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: ...But I must remind you that the crimes of Dan Feng have had far-reaching implications... and some people, such as those in Scalegorge Waterscape, will not be much moved by the issuance of a paper edict.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: While I can guarantee your freedom to come and go as you please, I cannot guarantee your safety. Again, I hope you can understand.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I understand.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: This issuing of gifts brings with it a sense of relief... Even my wound is feeling much improved. The occasion calls for a line or two of poetry... though I feel my efforts would be overshadowed by the erudition of Lady Fu. Another time, perhaps.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: The Express and its passengers have a long voyage ahead of them. May that voyage be smooth and untrammeled. I bid you Farewell.

text: Plan for the future after discussions with your companions

title: Step Description
content: Jing Yuan invites you to have a chat at the Seat of Divine Foresight when the ceremony ends. Once there, he presents Luofu's gift to the Express Crew — a jade abacus of allying oath. With this token in hand, the Cloud Knights swear to come to the aid of their allies, no matter the distance they must cross. Your current trailblazing journey on the Xianzhou has finally come to an end. Before you leave, you might be able to bid farewell to the people you got to know on this journey.

text: (Investigate the Jade Abacus on Jing Yuan's table, standard dialogue, optional)
The second half of Luofu's jade abacus of allying oath. It takes on the shape of a tiger — not sure if this detail carries any significance.
A symbol of friendship bestowed by the Xianzhou Luofu. As valuable as the gift is, you were secretly hoping that they'd gave each of you a manor in Exalting Sanctum.

According to Jing Yuan, holding the jade abacus firmly in your hand will send out a message to the Cloud Knights and they will rush to your aid. It's difficult to resist the temptation of giving it a try right now.
Looking at the plain color of jade and patina, it's easy to think that such an item is of no particular value. But the golden inlay points to its noble origin.

(Talk toYanqingin the Seat of Divine Foresight, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Yanqing
line: Oh hi, I know we haven't got the chance to get acquainted, but I've heard a lot of good things about the crew from the general. I have to say I'm very impressed.

speaker: Yanqing
line: So soon?

speaker: Yanqing
line: *sigh* I wanted to help the general, but things didn't turn out how I wanted them to be. I've learned my lesson.

speaker: Yanqing
line: Also, I have a rather abrupt request.

speaker: Yanqing
line: ▶ After fighting Dan Heng, I feel like my skills are lacking somewhere. If you have any time to coach me...

text: I think Dan Heng is a better match for you...

children.speaker: Yanqing
children.line: I'm worried that he still holds some grudge against me. But to be honest, I'd love to have another spar with him.

text: We could schedule in a couple of rounds...

children.speaker: Yanqing
children.line: Deal.

speaker: Yanqing
line: Safe travels.

speaker: Yanqing
line: Safe travels.

text:
(Talk toFu Xuanin theDivination Commission, near theConclave Hallteleporter, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Are you here to say goodbye?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: There's no need to be so anxious. I predict that you will return to the Xianzhou often, and you will definitely continue to trouble us when you do.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Therefore, forget about any farewells.

text: Even if I do return, this is still a farewell, right?
...Is that really everything you want to say?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Alright, okay, I understand.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: I wish your travels be fleeting of foot, and may your crises be effortlessly resolved.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: May your travels be fleeting of foot, and may your crises be effortlessly resolved.

text:
(Talk toBailuin Exalting Sanctum straight ahead on the right from theCourt of TranquilitySpace Anchor, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Bailu
line: ▶ Hello, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Bailu
line: ...To start your next journey... That's great. *sigh* I can't wait to escape the Commission again...

speaker: Bailu
line: Oh, make sure you come visit! Next time you're here, we'll put my plan into action...

speaker: Bailu
line: I've got it all figured out. We sneak out, head over to Aurum Alley, and pig out on the snacks there!

text: ...Or I could just go there myself.

children.speaker: Bailu
children.line: ...Hmph, I know all the best places, — you'll be lost without me.

text: Better start planning that escape route then.

children.speaker: Bailu
children.line: Mm-hmm, it's a deal.

speaker: Bailu
line: Aaaand don't forget to come see me if you get any headaches, fever, tendon pain, joint pain — anything! My treatment is on the house!

speaker: Bailu
line: Remember to come and see me!

text:
(Talk toQingquein Exalting Sanctum standing at a table in the upstairs dining area betweenSynwood Pavilionand the exit to the Divination Commission, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Qingque
line: I'm guessing seeing you here probably means your affairs on the Xianzhou are mostly complete?

speaker: Qingque
line: Is that it? I thought you were gonna stay for at least a little longer...

speaker: Qingque
line: Did Welt learn how to play celestial jade in the end...? If he hasn't got the hang of it yet, tell him to come see me and I'll show him the ropes.

speaker: Qingque
line: Oh, I haven't asked you yet — are you interested in learning yourself?

text: Sure, if it's easy to learn.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: Aha, I thought so. Come back when you have time — I'll teach you.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: C'mon... If you learned how to play, then you, Welt, and March would only need to find one more person! You could get a table going and play a few rounds during your travels.

speaker: Qingque
line: We're in agreement then. You can come back any time and I'll teach you how to play.

speaker: Qingque
line: We're in agreement then. You can come back any time and I'll teach you how to play.

text:
(Talk toSushangin front of the Sleepless Earl, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Sushang
line: Hi?

text: Are you listening to Mr. Xiyan 's stories?

speaker: Sushang
line: Sure am. Things have been in constant turmoil since I transferred to the Luofu. Now that I've got a little free time, I'm here to listen to some storytelling.

speaker: Sushang
line: Are you... Sorry, I've met so many people recently, you seem unfamiliar... Judging by your clothes, you must be an outworlder?

text: Dan Heng told me all about...

children.speaker: Sushang
children.line: Ahh, I see! Silent But Deadly told me something about meeting up with a friend. You must be them?

children.text: ...Silent But Deadly?

children.speaker: Sushang
children.line: Mm-hmm, pretty accurate nickname, right? That guy has a lot on his plate — it's enough to make you worry.

children.speaker: Sushang
children.line: The fact you're standing here right now must mean things are pretty much taken care of?

children.text: I'm leaving the Luofu.

speaker: Sushang
line: Is that so? Well, before you leave, I recommend listening to Mr. Xiyan's Legend of the High-Cloud Quintet .

speaker: Sushang
line: Ever since I was a little kid, I've always wanted to be an epic hero... I never get tired of hearing about the Quintet — I'm sure you'll love it.

speaker: Sushang
line: You should bring Dan Heng along next time, we can chat over some tea. Anyway, I'm getting off-track, I won't take any more of your time. Good luck.

speaker: Sushang
line: You should bring Dan Heng along next time, we can chat over some tea.

text:
(Talk toYukongin front of the Palace of Astrum, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Yukong
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), are you off then?

speaker: Yukong
line: The Xianzhou Luofu is all the richer for your brief time with us. I offer blessings on behalf of the Sky-Faring Commission, on the eve of your departure.

speaker: Yukong
line: If you require resupplying during your journey, you can always count on us.

speaker: Yukong
line: Life is fleeting. We hope you'll have the opportunity to return to us on the Luofu soon.

text:
(Talk toMaster Gongshuin theArtisanship Commission, near the exit to the Divination Commission inArcane Moorage, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Master Gongshu
line: The Artisanship Commission has come through hell and high water since the incident. Rebuilding what we lost will drain the years, our labor filled with blood, and sweat, and tears!

speaker: Master Gongshu
line: For a youngster to deliver a farewell to an old man like me is a rare occurrence in this day and age.

speaker: Master Gongshu
line: *sigh* I've taken on many a short-life apprentice — after leaving the Luofu, they never return. Time, not distance, is the true separator of souls.

speaker: Master Gongshu
line: The lingering sound of bygone music plays, though groweth fainter with the parting ways.

children.speaker: Master Gongshu
children.line: I'm glad. I'll still be here at the Artisanship Commission. You're welcome any time.

children.speaker: Master Gongshu
children.line: Life is full of farewells, and I've seen more than most.

speaker: Master Gongshu
line: *sigh* But farewell it is. I shall not sing for you on your way out... I fear the sound would break my heartstrings...

speaker: Master Gongshu
line: *sigh* But farewell it is. I shall not sing for you on your way out... I fear the sound would break my heartstrings...

text:
(Talk toDitingin Central Starskiff Haven near the Starskiff Jetty teleport, optional)
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Diting
line: Woof woof!

speaker: Diting
line: *whimpers*

speaker: Diting
line: Rrr—ruff ruff woof! Woof woof!

text: What's that? You're gonna miss me?

speaker: Diting
line: Woof woof! Rr—ruff!

text: Diting lifts its front paws, draws an arch in the air with its round head, turns around, and runs off into the distance.
It looks like he has something to show you.

speaker: Diting
line: Woof woof!

text: Is this... a gift for me!?

speaker: Diting
line: Woof~

text: Diting circles around and sits down, expectantly wanting to see you open the chest and get something nice.
I guess a dog really is a man's best friend after all.

speaker: Diting
line: Woof!

speaker: Diting
line: Woof! Woof woof!

text:
(Talk toXiaoyuin Exalting Sanctum near the Synwood Pavilion teleport, optional)[Note 1]
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Xiaoyu
line: ▶ Is that you, ( big brother / big sister ) ?

speaker: Xiaoyu
line: I knew it was you by the sound of your footsteps.

text: It's me. I'm planning on leaving the Luofu.

speaker: Xiaoyu
line: You're leaving?

speaker: Xiaoyu
line: ▶ Thank you for helping me... and thanks to Dan Shu too. I should be taller the next time you're back, so I won't be such a burden on everyone.

speaker: Xiaoyu
line: By the way, is Dan Shu okay? Me and my friends are worried about her... We haven't heard from her since the last time she delivered the medicine.

text: She's... on sabbatical studying medicinal pellets.

children.speaker: Xiaoyu
children.line: Oh, I understand. Making pellets must be very hard work — we shouldn't bug her.

children.speaker: Xiaoyu
children.line: When I grow up, I want to be a great alchemist like Dan Shu — making medicine and helping the incomplete ones!

children.speaker: Xiaoyu
children.line: ▶ Well... bye-bye, ( big brother / big sister ) . Have a safe journey!

children.speaker: Xiaoyu
children.line: Dead... What does "dead" mean? Does it mean, going to a really really really far away place forever and ever, and never coming back? Like my mommy and daddy?

children.text: That's one way of putting it...
She committed a serious crime... and was executed on the spot.

children.speaker: Xiaoyu
children.line: So... Dan Shu will never come to see us again?

children.text: The little girl stares in your direction in silence, but the look in her eyes says a lot.

children.speaker: Xiaoyu
children.line: ▶ Thanks for telling me, ( big brother / big sister ) . Like Dan Shu always said, we can't expect others to take care of us forever.

children.speaker: Xiaoyu
children.line: ▶ Goodbye, ( big brother / big sister ) .

speaker: Xiaoyu
line: ▶ Bye, ( big brother / big sister ) .

text:
(Talk toArrogant Kidin Exalting Sanctum behind theSpare Time Book Shop, optional)[Note 1]
(Initial interaction)

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: *sigh* What do we do now? We don't really have to turn over a new leaf, do we?

speaker: Mean Kid
line: No way. We pretend to obey the grownups, then get back to business as soon as we get the chance!

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: Hey, what are you looking at? This is our conversation, okay? Hmm... Why does this outworlder seem so familiar to me?

speaker: Hateful Kid
line: ▶ Hey boss, I recognize ( him / her ) ! ( He's / She's ) the one who messed with us last time!

speaker: Mean Kid
line: I remember now! Last time we dealt with this one we got into big trouble!

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: Ah, it's you! You're the one who betrayed us, right?

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: We've been ordered to change our name from "The Luofu Trio" to "The Luofu Study Club..." It's so embarrassing! Now no-one's gonna respect us anymore...

speaker: Mean Kid
line: So tell us — how much compensation are you gonna give?

text: I'm planning on leaving the Luofu.

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: Huh? Trying to flee?

speaker: Mean Kid
line: *sigh* Boss, let's just forget about it. Let this bad omen off the Luofu so we can get on with business.

speaker: Hateful Kid
line: Just go then, what's it gotta do with us? You think we're friends or something? You wanna say goodbye to us?

text: Dan Shu asked me to bring you a message.

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: Dan Shu? Who's Dan Shu?

speaker: Mean Kid
line: She's the leader of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus — the one everyone was talking about!

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: *gulp* Sanctus... Medicus? Wh—wh—what do you want with me?

speaker: Hateful Kid
line: You want us to join you or something?

text: Stay away from Xiaoyu, y'hear? Otherwise...

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: Y—You guys must think you're pretty tough, bullying kids like us out in the open.

speaker: Mean Kid
line: Time to throw in the towel boss — they're playing for real. If you wanna start a fight with the Disciples, I'm out.

speaker: Hateful Kid
line: Ugh, guess you're right, these guys mean business. My mom said they eat three or four kids for breakfast!

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: Y—Yeah... Ahem! Hey, you — we promise not to bully Xiaoyu again, if you promise not to mess with us.

text: And don't bully any other kids, either.
That depends on your end of the bargain.

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: O—O—Okay, we promise! But you have to keep your word too!

speaker: Hateful Kid
line: Then as the Luofu Trio, we...

speaker: Arrogant Kid
line: Shh! We're the Luofu Study Club now! Don't say anything about the Trio. You ought to be more afraid of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus!

speaker: Mean Kid
line: Good thinking, Boss! Long live the Luofu Study Club!

speaker: Welt
line: Himeko messaged me — the Express detected the Jade Gate's re-opening. She asked whether we'd be heading back any time soon.

speaker: Welt
line: She was also asking after you, Dan Heng. I think it'd be best for you to update her in person, don't you think?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: She must have been worried. I'll return to the train and put her mind at rest.

speaker: March 7th
line: Himeko must be eager to hear about what we've been up to on this mission too, right?

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Uh, hang on. How could I forget. We should bring something back for the conductor . (Trailblazer), have you got any unfinished business on the Xianzhou?

text: I'd like to visit some of the friends we made along the way...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Oh yeah, there are some people we haven't said goodbye to yet!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I've got goldfish memory — we haven't had a chance to say goodbye to everyone we met so far on this trip.

speaker: Welt
line: ▶ Fine, fine. Dan Heng and I will go back to the Express. The two of you come back soon, okay?

speaker: March 7th
line: Don't worry, Mr. Yang.

text: Return to the Express and report back to Himeko

title: Step Description
content: Jing Yuan invites you to have a chat at the Seat of Divine Foresight when the ceremony ends. Once there, he presents Luofu's gift to the Express Crew — a jade abacus of allying oath. With this token in hand, the Cloud Knights swear to come to the aid of their allies, no matter the distance they must cross. Your current trailblazing journey on the Xianzhou has finally come to an end. Before you leave, you might be able to bid farewell to the people you got to know on this journey.You take a mental note of everything. The Seat of Divine Foresight, Starskiff Haven, Exalting Sanctum, the Divination Commission, and the Artisanship Commission... You've made quite a few friends this trip.

speaker: Welt
line: Dan Heng and I will go back to the Express first. You and March finish up here and come back soon, alright?

speaker: March 7th
line: We've been so busy running around in circles, we haven't gotten the chance to say goodbye to friends we've just met — I feel like parting is still such sweet sorrow.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Who should I go to first? The Master Diviner? Qingque? The miracle doctor? Or what about Master Gongshu? *sigh* (Trailblazer), shall we go and meet them all?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: When I left the train, I only had time to say a quick goodbye to Himeko.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I should go back and give her an update... and thank her for her guidance.

text: (Dialogue immediately begins upon returning to the Express)

speaker: Himeko
line: There's a dreamlike quality to watching these starskiffs depart through the Jade Gate. How long will these ships sail, and which stars are they traveling to?

speaker: Welt
line: From a universal perspective, there is little difference between the lives of long and short-life species. The transcendence that the Xianzhou pursues is nothing compared to the enduring majesty of the stars. And the grief felt here... is no different from our own.

text: Didn't know you were a poet, Mr. Yang.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: ▶ You're back, (Trailblazer). Himeko and I were just discussing our journey.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: This little excursion has reached its conclusion — all things must come to an end. Still, some endings spark a new beginning.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: ▶ (Trailblazer), you're back. Welt was telling me about your experiences — I'm more than a little envious! The Ambrosial Arbor, the Ebon Deer , the Divination Commission Matrix, Scalegorge Waterscape...

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: I pestered Dan Heng to tell me about his experiences, but alas, what could've been a magnificent saga was reduced to a few words and a grunt.

speaker: Himeko
line: Next time, I think I should be the one trailblazing with you guys — Welt can stay on the Express.

speaker: Welt
line: ...Since when did the work roster just change like that?

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Penacony . Do you remember? Before Kafka's proposal, that was our original destination.

text: So, we can warp jump as planned this time?

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Yes. No more Stellaron Hunter interruptions — it's time to get our original plan back on track. Our next stop is Penacony, remember?

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: The Express' records show that Penacony was a prison planet used by the IPC to exile criminals... At least, it was at the time of recording.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: However, following a Stellaron burst, the planet fell into the arms of Xipe . They say it's been transformed into a prosperous and ethereal realm.

speaker: Himeko
line: The Family is throwing a banquet there, and they sent invitations out to the Express. I was curious about the state of the planet, so I accepted.

speaker: Himeko
line: When the conductor is ready, we can set off for the next stop.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: All who enter here...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: ...are either jailers...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: ...or prisoners.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Which are you?

children.speaker: Luocha
children.line: Neither. I'm merely a lost traveler.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: What a spectacle! The Stellaron, the Ambrosial Arbor, the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, the Lord Ravager...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: ...a series of threats...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: ...that almost succeeded in diverting attention away...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: ...from the crucial question...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: They who brought the Stellaron onto the Xianzhou...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: What was their motive?

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Will you surrender...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: ...or do you require encouragement...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: ...abomination of Yaoshi .

children.speaker: Luocha
children.line: General, my power does indeed stem from the Abundance .

children.speaker: Luocha
children.line: But I'm the same as you.

children.speaker: Luocha
children.line: We are both enemies of Yaoshi.

children.speaker: Jingliu
children.line: That's right, Jing Yuan.

children.speaker: Jingliu
children.line: Stay out of our way.

children.speaker: Jingliu
children.line: The revival of the Arbor is an omen. It's time for the Xianzhou to choose its next path.

children.speaker: Jingliu
children.line: The Reignbow Arbiter, the Plagues Author, the Ruin Author ...

children.speaker: Jingliu
children.line: This is a chess game between Aeons . If you don't stand with the winners, you stand to lose.

children.speaker: Jingliu
children.line: And this time,

children.speaker: Jingliu
children.line: We will put the Abundance in their grave.

speaker: Himeko
line: Penacony is throwing a banquet — I've received an invitation from The Family.

speaker: Himeko
line: When the conductor is ready, we can set off for the next stop.

speaker: Welt
line: Our time on the Xianzhou has come to an end. Back to the original plan, I suppose?
